{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3356617,"name":"Dominick Ferone","username":"Dominick_Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T17:55:48.214Z","cooked":"

As teams are getting ready for champs or the offseason I want to bring a little battery care/maintenance. This year I noticed my teams struggling with batteries draining quicker, more brownouts, and battery performance decreasing.

While we were conducting our standard checklist/comparison of battery health and tracking their degrade I discovered something we missed. Many of our batteries that were preforming ok had cables in some rough shape at the crimps.

When I untaped and peeled back, I noticed many strands of broken wire at the crimps connecting to the terminal. What seemed to be common on all of the ones with this issue were the pre-assembled ones from AndyMark. The ones with the Pink SB50 connector on it were the ones more likely to have broken strands.
It looks like these premade cables were using smaller wire strands which would be more susceptible to breaking. When I replaced some of the leads the batteries were falling more in our range of quality for competition batteries.

The last thing a team needs is the battery to be not up to snuff for champs, so remember to do a once-over on the wires, crimps, and mounting hardware. In the future, we may adjust our testing to have every battery be tested with the same brand-new cables to give a battery baseline and test with the cables we took off as a way to see if it’s time to swap the leads.

Dominick_Ferone:

What seemed to be common on all of the ones with this issue were the pre-assembled ones from AndyMark . The ones with the Pink SB50 connector on it were the ones more likely to have broken strands.

I’m confused here, because AndyMark only sells battery cables with the red SB-50 housing where the pink SB-50s are exclusively donated to the kit and I don’t know the origins of the attached wire. So which one is it, or are you seeing them on both?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-09T19:45:14.910Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":517,"readers_count":516,"score":108.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461959,"topic_slug":"psa-check-your-battery-leads","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-your-battery-leads/461959/2","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3356750,"name":"Dominick Ferone","username":"Dominick_Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T19:50:24.553Z","cooked":"

Not sure if in the past they sold the pink ones or maybe from FIRST Choice? All I know is between my 3 teams we had many of the pink ones. In the Black Tote checklist it shows the pink one as the part number I linked, maybe they just haven’t updated the image?

Maybe @Andy_Baker could shed more light on the differences?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-09T19:50:24.553Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":456,"readers_count":455,"score":101.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461959,"topic_slug":"psa-check-your-battery-leads","display_username":"Dominick Ferone","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19411,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"353/358 Mentor - Formerly 5030/9016 "},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-your-battery-leads/461959/3","custom_user_title":"353/358 Mentor - Formerly 5030/9016 ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3356884,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T21:46:32.533Z","cooked":"

The AM cables have too BIG wires in them. The bigger the strands, the easier it is to fatigue and break them. Fine strands are a much better choice for FRC.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-09T21:46:32.533Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":382,"readers_count":381,"score":96.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461959,"topic_slug":"psa-check-your-battery-leads","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-your-battery-leads/461959/4","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3356888,"name":"Dominick Ferone","username":"Dominick_Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T21:48:24.833Z","cooked":"

I feel like all the wires with larger copper strands inside were our leads that survived longer. The smaller strands seemed to get more fatigue/have many strands break.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-09T21:48:24.833Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":366,"readers_count":365,"score":78.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461959,"topic_slug":"psa-check-your-battery-leads","display_username":"Dominick Ferone","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46443,"username":"Weldingrod1","name":"Rod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19411,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"353/358 Mentor - Formerly 5030/9016 "},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-your-battery-leads/461959/5","custom_user_title":"353/358 Mentor - Formerly 5030/9016 ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3356895,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T21:52:56.848Z","cooked":"

In general, stranded wire’s flexibility and fatigue life are improved by more, finer strands. It’s surprising that you’re seeing the opposite effect.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-09T21:52:56.848Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":345,"readers_count":344,"score":74.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461959,"topic_slug":"psa-check-your-battery-leads","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19411,"username":"Dominick_Ferone","name":"Dominick Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-your-battery-leads/461959/6","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3356899,"name":"Dominick Ferone","username":"Dominick_Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T21:54:04.198Z","cooked":"

Interesting, maybe it had something to do with the premade cables/crimps that made them more susceptible to breaking?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-09T21:54:04.198Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":332,"readers_count":331,"score":66.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461959,"topic_slug":"psa-check-your-battery-leads","display_username":"Dominick Ferone","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19411,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"353/358 Mentor - Formerly 5030/9016 "},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-your-battery-leads/461959/7","custom_user_title":"353/358 Mentor - Formerly 5030/9016 ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3356928,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T22:20:06.764Z","cooked":"

The wire with larger strands tends to be stiffer, which often means bending happens more right at the crimps than would otherwise be the case. So, this creates a stress concentration is more prone to fatigue cracking. The end with the SB50 is less likely to have this happen, because of the housing, but also just how the wires tend to be flexed.

Regardless, checking things over is good advice!

EDIT: These wires tend to also have stiff insulation, which often stops right before the crimp – putting more bend into a short segment of the wire when it is having to flex.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-10T01:52:22.624Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":316,"readers_count":315,"score":78.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461959,"topic_slug":"psa-check-your-battery-leads","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-your-battery-leads/461959/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3356931,"name":"Jon K.","username":"Jon_K","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/7cd45c/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T22:23:51.783Z","cooked":"

Not Andy, but formerly was in charge of manufacturing for AndyMark. AM has NEVER had pink SB50s. Those are provided to FIRST Choice or the KoP tote from Anderson Power Products directly. It is a custom SB50 from APP for FIRST use. It is keyed to the red SB50, vs other color SB50 connectors that do not work with the other colors.

I believe the reason the AM cable is linked is that it is the closest available COTS battery cable that a team can purchase.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-09T22:23:51.783Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":300,"readers_count":299,"score":175.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461959,"topic_slug":"psa-check-your-battery-leads","display_username":"Jon K.","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19411,"username":"Dominick_Ferone","name":"Dominick Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1038,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-your-battery-leads/461959/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3356957,"name":"Dominick Ferone","username":"Dominick_Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T23:04:04.001Z","cooked":"

Curious why I noticed more issue with these Kop/first choice ones. Maybe it’s something to do with the tinned ends, crimps, or more insulation being peeled back so far? Otherwise it’s just a coincidence why most of the failures were coming with these cables I guess.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-09T23:04:04.001Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":259,"readers_count":258,"score":56.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461959,"topic_slug":"psa-check-your-battery-leads","display_username":"Dominick Ferone","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":1038,"username":"Jon_K","name":"Jon K.","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/7cd45c/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19411,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"353/358 Mentor - Formerly 5030/9016 "},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-your-battery-leads/461959/10","custom_user_title":"353/358 Mentor - Formerly 5030/9016 ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3356967,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T23:21:19.499Z","cooked":"

Worth noting that every pink-ended cable I’ve seen has had bare untinned wire for people to crimp their own connectors on where the AndyMark ones are crimped using a big pneumatic crimper and have branded heat shrink on the wires.

So if it’s crimps failing on a pink-housing wire, it’s probably a self-inflicted issue. If it’s a red housing but not an AM cable, then it could be from any number of vendors that also sell compatible cables; I know CTRE and Powerwerx both will sell you a comparable cable.

If you’re needing a crimper improvement, this $34 Amazon crimper was recommended to us and worked gangbusters this year.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-09T23:21:19.499Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":255,"readers_count":254,"score":96.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461959,"topic_slug":"psa-check-your-battery-leads","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00MVE48Z6","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":25},{"url":"https://store.ctr-electronics.com/battery-cable/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Battery Cable - Unless I’m miss remembering the ones I were checking and the AndyMark shrink wrap but pink Anderson. So maybe it’s just a mix of me miss remembering, but I know vividly the wires were smaller strand and tinned.

Just jumping here, the pink ones are for breast cancer awareness and were provided many years ago. They are made with the same mold as the Red ones. This is needed as colors in the SB line are keyed differently so they cannot be mated. A blue SB50 will not mate with the Red. Most often, broken wires at the point of strip are due to improper stripping. The strands become nicked and have a tendency to break instead of bend when flexed. If you route the two wires together on top or side of the battery and then add ty-wraps (wire ties) the wire will not flex at the terminal.
